forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle. Mostly clear, with a low around 60. West wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of drizzle before 11am. Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 70 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As dawn softly approaches Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a hint of the night’s gentle drizzle—a whisper of moisture hanging around as the world begins to stir. The skies remain mostly clear, with the low temperature embracing the 60s, while a mild west wind brushes against the skin, stirring the leaves of the trees like an early morning melody. Today promises a delightful transition from the cool embrace of the morning to the vibrant warmth of a sunlit afternoon, where temperatures will rise to a comfortable 72 degrees before settling back to the low 70s. The forecast hints at a slight chance of drizzle, but either way, the day is poised for sun-drenched expanses under a blue canopy.

As for fog, it seems to linger just beyond the horizons, delicately parting ways to reveal glimpses of the Golden Gate, inviting a stroll along the waterfront or perhaps a leisurely coffee in one of the local cafes. The air is effortlessly refreshing, suggesting layers to navigate the shifting temperatures—perhaps a light jacket for the morning and a simple tee for the day ahead. It is the kind of day that encourages exploration: a walk through the Presidio, a visit to the bustling Ferry Building Market, or simply a quiet moment at a park, soaking in the sights and sounds unique to San Francisco, where every corner tells a story.
